value.halfverse: from age to age my mouth will proclaim your faithfulness.
value.verse: Your love, O LORD, for ever will I sing; *
For I am persuaded that your love is established for ever; *
value.halfverse: you have set your faithfulness firmly in the heavens.
I have sworn an oath to David my servant:
value.verse: “I have made a covenant with my chosen one; *

value.halfverse: and preserve your throne for all generations.’”
value.verse: ‘I will establish your line for ever, *

value.halfverse: and to your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones;
value.verse: The heavens bear witness to your wonders, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: who is like the LORD among the gods?
value.verse: For who in the skies can be compared to the LORD? *

value.halfverse: great and terrible to all those round about him.
value.verse: God is much to be feared in the council of the holy ones, *

value.halfverse: O mighty LORD, your faithfulness is all around you.
value.verse: Who is like you, LORD God of hosts? *
You rule the raging of the sea *
value.halfverse: and still the surging of its waves.

value.verse: You have crushed Rahab of the deep with a deadly wound; *
value.halfverse: you have scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.

value.verse: Yours are the heavens; the earth also is yours; *
value.halfverse: you laid the foundations of the world and all that is in it.
Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your Name.
value.verse: You have made the north and the south; *

value.halfverse: strong is your hand and high is your right hand.
value.verse: You have a mighty arm; *

value.halfverse: love and truth go before your face.
value.verse: Righteousness and justice are the foundations of your throne; *

value.halfverse: they walk, O LORD, in the light of your presence.
value.verse: Happy are the people who know the festal shout! *
They rejoice daily in your Name; *
value.halfverse: they are jubilant in your righteousness.

value.verse: For you are the glory of their strength, *
value.halfverse: and by your favor our might is exalted.
The Holy One of Israel is our King.
value.verse: Truly, the LORD is our ruler; *
You spoke once in vision and said to your faithful people: *
value.halfverse:
“I have set the crown upon a warrior
 and have exalted one chosen out of the people.
with my holy oil have I anointed him.
value.verse: I have found David my servant; *

value.halfverse: and my arm will make him strong.
value.verse: My hand will hold him fast *

value.halfverse: nor any wicked man bring him down.
value.verse: No enemy shall deceive him, *

value.halfverse: and strike down those who hate him.
value.verse: I will crush his foes before him *
My faithfulness and love shall be with him, *
value.halfverse: and he shall be victorious through my Name.

value.verse: I shall make his dominion extend *
value.halfverse: from the Great Sea to the River.

value.verse: He will say to me, ‘You are my Father, *
value.halfverse: my God, and the rock of my salvation.’

value.verse: I will make him my firstborn *
value.halfverse: and higher than the kings of the earth.
and my covenant will stand firm for him.
value.verse: I will keep my love for him for ever, *

value.halfverse: and his throne as the days of heaven.”
value.verse: I will establish his line for ever *

value.halfverse: and do not walk according to my judgments;
value.verse: “If his children forsake my law *
If they break my statutes *
value.halfverse: and do not keep my commandments;

value.verse: I will punish their transgressions with a rod *
value.halfverse: and their iniquities with the lash;

value.verse: But I will not take my love from him, *
value.halfverse: nor let my faithfulness prove false.
nor change what has gone out of my lips.
value.verse: I will not break my covenant, *

value.halfverse: ‘I will not lie to David.
value.verse: Once for all I have sworn by my holiness: *

value.halfverse: and his throne as the sun before me;
value.verse: His line shall endure for ever *
It shall stand fast for evermore like the moon, *
value.halfverse: the abiding witness in the sky.’”
you have become enraged at him.
value.verse: But you have cast off and rejected your anointed; *

value.halfverse: defiled his crown, and hurled it to the ground.
value.verse: You have broken your covenant with your servant, *
You have breached all his walls *
value.halfverse: and laid his strongholds in ruins.
he has become the scorn of his neighbors.
value.verse: All who pass by despoil him; *
You have exalted the right hand of his foes *
value.halfverse: and made all his enemies rejoice.

value.verse: You have turned back the edge of his sword *
value.halfverse: and have not sustained him in battle.
and cast his throne to the ground.
value.verse: You have put an end to his splendor *
You have cut short the days of his youth *
value.halfverse: and have covered him with shame.
how long will your anger burn like fire?
value.verse:
How long will you hide yourself, O LORD?
will you hide yourself for ever? *
Remember, LORD, how short life is, *
value.halfverse: how frail you have made all flesh.
who can save himself from the power of the grave?
value.verse: Who can live and not see death? *

value.halfverse: which you promised David in your faithfulness?
value.verse: Where, Lord, are your loving-kindnesses of old, *

value.halfverse: how I carry in my bosom the taunts of many peoples,
value.verse: Remember, Lord, how your servant is mocked, *

value.halfverse: which they hurled at the heels of your anointed.
value.verse: The taunts your enemies have hurled, O LORD, *
Blessed be the LORD for evermore! *
value.halfverse: Amen, I say, Amen.
